text: Hello everyone. I'm new and I just had the question that why do we have to create a designer account and make templates there? My parent company account has no option in web template creation with Marketing pro, so once I make my templates in the designer account, how do I transfer them over to my main account?¯\_(ツ)_/¯

Hey all, just wanted to give everyone a heads up. We're renaming "lead flows" to "pop-up forms" to help make the tool clearer to users. We're aiming to push this change on 3rd December for the moment. Nothing is changing within the tool with this update, just the name.
Thanks for the heads-up .... it will be easier to explain what leadflows really are to our clients :slightly_smiling_face:
i.e. pop-ups :slightly_smiling_face:
We use this “label” for months yeah :smile:

Trying to build a testimonials slider like the one showcased here on Make Offices: <https://makeoffices.com/>. Does anyone have a favorite slider plugin they like to use where I could build something similar to Make Offices?
Hi Hi <@UE7846LCU> Great question. This is very common where a developer creates a "repository" of assets and then moves them to different portals for use in a project. Here are a few resources:
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/articles/kcs-article/cos-general/how-do-i-copy-a-blog-email-page-template-from-one-portal-to-another>
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/account/can-i-merge-data-resources-between-different-HubSpot-accounts>
Thanks for informing the community <@U7Q9HPCTE>!!!
slick is my go to.  was convenient when i found out HubSpot uses it, too
i dont like that the testimonials do not fit on the page with the slide dots
not that you have any say on this site :)
Agreed, go with Slick Slider, they also take accessibility into account.
problem with using slick slider for this is that you have to do a fair amount of custom coding to make the transitions between slides and visual 2 up effect look the same
Yeah I use slick all the time - but was hard to simulate the functionality on Make Offices
if you inspect the source code they are using slick
you’re looking at the wrong slider
the slick slider is for the: Affordable, Flexible area
not for the testimonials section
the testimonials slider is the one he wants to emmulate, not using slick slider, can’t identify what it is, the locations one is slick slider
ah… the testimonials slides has an `aria-describedby="slick-slide{{#}}"`
idk
thanks for looking <@U3T21PDBK>
I find Flickity easy to use as well, if you're looking for an alternative to Slick - <https://flickity.metafizzy.co/>
there is alwaysthis type of solution... <https://code.tutsplus.com/tutorials/create-the-perfect-carousel-part-1--cms-29481>
Cool tutorial
Tuts Plus used to be my go to back in the day!
Thanks a ton Luke!
